{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3177157,"name":"EFastring","username":"EFastring","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/7bcc69/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-30T15:58:50.329Z","cooked":"

We have a sponsor offering us $5,000 to purchase a single large item that we can use to help production.

We already have a Omio CNC, an 80watt CO2 laser engraver (awesome for prototyping), and a manual mill (old and has a cracked head).

What would be a suggestion for another purchase to supplement our fabrication capabilities? CNC Lathe? CNC plasma or waterjet? It might be possible that we could put some money along with the donation to increase the budget a bit.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-03-30T15:58:50.329Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":30,"reads":395,"readers_count":394,"score":234.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432407,"topic_slug":"need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000","display_username":"EFastring","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9913,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000/432407/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3177164,"name":"CEF","username":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-30T16:04:30.435Z","cooked":"

A good 3d printer that will do a variety of materials and has two printheads.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-03-30T16:04:30.435Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":391,"readers_count":390,"score":78.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":432407,"topic_slug":"need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000","display_username":"CEF","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000/432407/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3177167,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-30T16:06:35.620Z","cooked":"

Swap over to rev if you are running vex currently…

Just my 2cents.

Since it needs to be tools. A small hobby lathe for shafts (with dro), and smaller ticket item(s) like a (larger) arbor press, cold cut saw, etc are very nice quality of life improvements. Just any of those at the near 5000 price point are way overkill for FRC.

I am sure spectrum’s what to spend your next $XXXX on resources will get linked in by someone soon.

Single item, printer is probably the easiest call to spend as much of the 5k on.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-03-30T16:09:44.814Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":383,"readers_count":382,"score":151.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":432407,"topic_slug":"need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000/432407/3","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3177169,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-30T16:07:24.004Z","cooked":"

A Prusia 3D printer would be good. What saws do you have? I’ve been thinking about getting a cold saw or a horizontal band saw so that cutting materials is precise and safe.

Plasma is a waste of time from my experience and waterjet is way outside your budget. CNC lathes aren’t really worth much in FRC from my experience, but a nice manual mill and lathe with a DRO is well worth the money.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-03-30T16:07:24.004Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":367,"readers_count":366,"score":113.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":432407,"topic_slug":"need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000","display_username":"John Fogarty","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12688,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000/432407/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3177183,"name":"Nick.kremer","username":"Nick.kremer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nick.kremer/{size}/174932_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-30T16:18:49.588Z","cooked":"

Depending on your manufacturing workflow, you may consider a 2nd Omio. My team has 2, one for tube with a tube jig and one for plate. This setup has been a game changer for us. We save tons of time with this parallel manufacturing and not needing to tram the vices.

I’ll echo what others in this thread have said, absolutely get a 3D printer (or 2 or 3 if the grant allows that) if you don’t already have one.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-03-30T16:19:44.449Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":343,"readers_count":342,"score":68.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":432407,"topic_slug":"need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000","display_username":"Nick.kremer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19714,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3512AM || Grand Arbiter of Morals"},"post_url":"/t/need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000/432407/5","custom_user_title":"3512AM || Grand Arbiter of Morals","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3177188,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-30T16:22:28.585Z","cooked":"
EFastring:

(old and has a cracked head).

If your team heavily relies on this, then maybe a new mill and some tooling?

JohnFogarty:

A Prusia 3D printer would be good.

Prusa just came out with the MK4 yesterday too, and it looks awesome. Highly recommend Prusa 3D Printers.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-03-30T16:25:35.139Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":305,"readers_count":304,"score":126.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432407,"topic_slug":"need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000","display_username":"Nick Matthes ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25311,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000/432407/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3177197,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-30T16:31:49.811Z","cooked":"
nmatthes:

Highly recommend Prusa 3D Printers.

Ditto. Whatever you give up in raw performance or higher price you get back in reliability and support. In a time crunch like FRC, that’s valuable.

If I had money to throw at printers right now, the play would be to order multiples for extra bandwidth. Whether those are Minis or the new MK4 model would depend on space and precise budget.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-03-30T16:31:49.811Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":284,"readers_count":283,"score":61.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":432407,"topic_slug":"need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000/432407/9","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3177212,"name":"Emilio Parra","username":"Emilio","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emilio/{size}/197052_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-30T16:43:30.083Z","cooked":"
Skyehawk:

I am sure spectrum’s what to spend your next $XXXX on resources will get linked in by someone soon.

As you already have a CNC and CO2 Laser, I highly recommend getting the new Prusa Mk4. But none the less:

docs.google.com

Spectrum's FIRST $10000

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-03-30T16:43:30.083Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":255,"readers_count":254,"score":111.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432407,"topic_slug":"need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000","display_username":"Emilio Parra","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1g4RsgqNOQ26HcZXcDfmj-IQ18zSy889kIrNSzEHR87w/edit","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Spectrum's FIRST $10000 - Google Sheets","clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":42196,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847 & Photon 8515"},"post_url":"/t/need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000/432407/10","custom_user_title":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847 & Photon 8515","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3177218,"name":"Ardiano Works","username":"MSU2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/msu2000/{size}/190139_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-30T16:49:16.855Z","cooked":"

No CNC lathe for $5000 unless it is junk with outdated controller, plus you don’t want CNC lathe anyway. Water jet is even more expensive. Plasma cutter is cool, but you will spend more than $5000 if you don’t have the supporting equipment like big enough air compressor, beefing up your electrical circuit, the space, the exhaust hood, not to mention trying to make it work reliably.

Get the tools that will help you to prototype quicker. you will need a load of iterations. Your final design can be cut from Water or Plasma, these should be affrodable, if you design it correctly.

If I have $5K, here is what I would do:
Prusa 3D printers, $1000 (used or new clone) one should do the job., 2 is nice, 3 would be awesome.
Portable band saw $400 ( with stand). You can cut raw stock, thin bracket with it, then mill it if you need other features.
Fixed that manual mill or buy Grizzly G0704 or better (your team summer project should be converting to CNC, not that hard). ($1000 used). IF the motor runs, the spindle is true, the ways are tight that is all you need.
Air compressor 20-30 gal, quite one if you can ($600). This is handy for cleaning, and testing out your Pneumatic. Nothing is more annoying when you are trying to bench test your design and you can’t talk to your team member because the compressor is running like a jet engine,
Manual lathe, small one. This would allow you to turn shafts and tapping it. ($1500). Although I would consider this a not priority.
Cutting tools, measuring tools, safety switches for all your machine. Remember, the kids are using it, safety first ($500). Pay little more on this measuring tools, gauges, etc. They will get abuse, dropped, and nicked.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-03-30T17:01:14.522Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":235,"readers_count":234,"score":72.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432407,"topic_slug":"need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000","display_username":"Ardiano Works","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57747,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000/432407/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3177421,"name":"sanddrag","username":"sanddrag","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-30T19:54:31.858Z","cooked":"

A box and pan brake can be useful. But, I second the suggestions for a good 3D printer, or possibly more than 1.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-03-30T19:54:31.858Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":165,"readers_count":164,"score":53.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":432407,"topic_slug":"need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/need-a-suggestion-for-buildspace-equipment-5-000/432407/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3177438,"name":"Thomas Gormley ","username":"ThomasG","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thomasg/{size}/175045_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-30T20:09:36.142Z","cooked":"

Get a decent lathe with a DRO installed.

Do you guys have a SawStop table saw? It may not necessarily improve robot manufacturing but is a very useful tool for prototypes and practice field elements.

if youre looking for a 3d printer i would highly suggest a bambulabs p1p or x1 if you can get it. they are amazing for rapid prototyping and good at competition if you need a fix there. we use a p1p with hardened nozzle and it has made many parts on our bot that are incredibly functional. Shop 3D Printers at Bambu Lab US | Bambu Lab US

Skyehawk:

like a (larger) arbor press, cold cut saw

I would skip an arbor press and just get a hydraulic press from Harbor Freight with cash. Cheaper, stronger, and taller working space without weighing a ridiculous amount.

The cold saw we got when our middle schools shop was going to toss it has been glorious. Best tools in the shop are a cold saw and a 24 inch cast iron disc sander.
